definition: panic-stricken
to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm
frightened
see 驚慌失措|惊慌失措[jing1 huang1 shi1 cuo4]

sentences.english: Then Haman was afraid before the king and the queen.
sentences.chinese: 哈曼在王和王后面前就甚驚惶。

sentences.english: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or discouraged.
sentences.chinese: 你當剛強壯膽，不要懼怕，也不要驚惶。

sentences.english: A scared calf's face gilded with marmalade.
sentences.chinese: 糊滿了桔子醬的臉驚惶得像頭小牛犢。

sentences.english: I am in struck with panically the hour just the attention arrive the mouth Diao of is a cake of abruptly of meat.
sentences.chinese: 我在驚惶失措時才注意到嘴裏叼的是一塊硬生生的肉。

sentences.english: Their people, drained of power, are dismayed and put to shame.
sentences.chinese: 所以其中的居民力量甚小，驚惶羞愧。

sentences.english: Natasha, pale and panic - stricken, flew into the drawing-room .
sentences.chinese: 娜塔莎臉色蒼白，驚惶失措，她跑進客廳裏去。

sentences.english: I tossed the mangoes at his feet and escaped in terror.
sentences.chinese: 我把芒果扔在他腳下，驚惶地逃開了。

sentences.english: There was a stampede of panic - stricken crowd from the burning hotel.
sentences.chinese: 一羣驚惶失措的人們，從失火的旅館中跑了出來。

sentences.english: Wherefore have I seen them dismayed and turned away back?
sentences.chinese: 我爲何看見他們驚惶轉身退後呢。

sentences.english: There the night flutters. Ah your body, a frightened statue, naked.
sentences.chinese: 啊，你的身體，驚惶如雕塑，一絲不掛。

sentences.english: They killed45 puppet troops and sent the rest fleeing panic-stricken.
sentences.chinese: 他們打死45名僞軍，使其他的人都驚惶逃竄了。

sentences.english: By this time Bertha was frightened out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 伯莎這時已恐慌得驚惶失措。

sentences.english: Then was king Belshazzar greatly troubled, and his countenance was changed in him, and his lords were astonied.
sentences.chinese: 伯沙撒王就甚驚惶，臉色改變，他的大臣也都驚奇。

sentences.english: You need a wardrobe of bras to avoid a panic situation when you’re getting dressed .
sentences.chinese: 你需要一衣櫥的文胸以避免盛裝時出現驚惶的情況。

sentences.english: To his consternation, he realized that he had left his chequebook at home.
sentences.chinese: 他意識到他把支票簿留在家裏就驚惶了。

definition: dejected/disheartened/listless
lit. crow and peacock make no sound/absolute silence (idiom); not a single voice can be heard/absolute silence
rushed and muddled
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
lit. dumb as a wooden chicken (idiom); fig. dumbstruck
bewildered
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
to keep silent
variant of 戰慄|战栗[zhan4 li4]
to lose one's head out of fear (idiom)
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to shiver
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
deeply worried and sick at heart (idiom)
to be alarmed/to be terrified
